introduction.title: Our Wildlife And Where To Find Them
introduction.description: Sri Lanka's wildlife invites you to witness the beauty of its untamed landscapes, fostering a deep appreciation for the delicate balance between nature and the diverse species that call this island home.

sinharajaForestReserve.title: Sinharaja Forrest Reserve
sinharajaForestReserve.description: Sinharaja, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a lush tropical rainforest that stands as a biodiversity hotspot. Home to a myriad of endemic species, including the Purple-faced Langur and the Ceylon Magpie, it offers a unique opportunity to explore an undisturbed natural habitat.

hortonPlainsNationalPark.title: Horton Plains National Park
hortonPlainsNationalPark.description: Amidst the central highlands, Horton Plains is characterized by rolling hills, misty landscapes, and diverse ecosystems. The park is known for its iconic World's End, offering breathtaking views. Visitors can encounter wildlife such as the Sambar Deer and explore the enchanting Baker's Falls.

animals.name: Sri Lankan Elephant
animals.facts: The Sri Lankan Elephant is the largest land mammal in Sri Lanka. It is an iconic and gentle species.

animals.name: Leopard
animals.facts: The Sri Lankan Leopard is a rare and elusive big cat native to Sri Lanka, known for its spotted coat.

animals.name: Blue Magpie
animals.facts: The Sri Lanka Blue Magpie is a vibrant bird species with striking blue plumage found in the island's forests.

summaryTable.courtesy: COURTSEY OF THE DEPARTMENT OF WILDLIFE CONSERVATION
